      • connect

        DLink<L> connect(Node<L> to)

        Connects this node to another node.

        The only prescription is that if this method succeeds, the other nod shows up in this nodes' neighbours()

        The particulars of the connection are not prescribed by this interface, nor does this interface prescribe what should happen when the connection already exists.

        Specified by:
        connect in interface Node<L>
        Parameters:
        other -

      • disconnect

        void disconnect(Node<L> other)
        Description copied from interface: Node
        Removes all links existing between this node and the given node. For directed graphs, this removes links going in both directions.
        Specified by:
        disconnect in interface Node<L>

      • connected

        boolean connected(Node<L> to)
        Description copied from interface: Node
        Whether the current node is connected to the given node. If the graph is directed, a connection in either direction will cause true to be returned.
        Specified by:
        connected in interface Node<L>
        Returns:

      • connectedTo

        boolean connectedTo(DNode<L> to)
        A directional version of connected(). Will return true, if and only if there exists a link from this node to the given node.
        Parameters:
        to -
        Returns:

      • links

        java.util.Collection<? extends DLink<L>> links(Node<L> other)
        Description copied from interface: Node
        Returns all links between this node and the given other node. For directed graphs, this will return links in both directions.
        Specified by:
        links in interface Node<L>
        Returns:

      • graph

        DGraph<L> graph()
        Returns the graph object to which these nodes belong. Nodes always belong to a single graph and cannot be exchanged between them.
        Specified by:
        graph in interface Node<L>
        Returns:
